A partitive construction refers to a part of something rather than a whole thing, for example, a slice of bread or one of the children. : partitive construction Number words can occur in the partitive construction. In Finnish, the same meanings are marked by accusative and partitive case endings.
More examplesFewer examplesIn the partitive construction, a plural noun form is required, even though reference is being made to only one object, e.g. "one of the cats". Unlike German, French has indefinite plural and partitive articles.The genitive and partitive suffixes were both one character long.

in some languages, a language structure, word, or word form that refers to a part of something rather than a whole thing: They excluded partitives such as "kind of" and "type of". Three case forms were examined: the partitive, the accusative, and the genitive.
More examplesFewer examplesThey usually express number meaning by means of partitives. There were 12 items that assessed the children's use of the partitive with singular nouns.
